ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of noise exposure (concert and work), characteristic sensorineural notch at 3000-4000 Hz, and recovery at high frequencies.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports constant bilateral tinnitus following noise exposure.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis (resolved)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of increased sensitivity to loud sounds immediately post-exposure, which has since improved.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and identify configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess retrocochlear pathway and confirm cochlear site of lesion.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic evaluation reveals normal hearing sensitivity in the low-to-mid frequencies bilaterally, sloping to a mild sensorineural notch at 3000-4000 Hz, and recovering to normal limits in the high frequencies. This configuration is consistent with noise-induced hearing loss. Speech recognition is excellent. Middle ear function is normal, though acoustic reflexes at 4000 Hz are elevated or absent, consistent with the cochlear damage at that frequency.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal 250-2000 Hz, mild SNHL notch at 3000 Hz (30 dB HL), recovery to normal at 4000-8000 Hz. Left ear: Normal 250-2000 Hz, slight SNHL notch at 3000-4000 Hz (20-25 dB HL), recovery to normal at 6000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: Right 2 dB HL, Left 5 dB HL. WRS: 100% at 50 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes normal 500-2000 Hz. Right elevated at 4000 Hz (105 dB HL). Left absent at 4000 Hz. Decay negative at 500 and 1000 Hz.

proposed_items: Continue using hearing protection when around loud sounds.
counseling_actions: Educate patient that hearing loss is due to history of noise exposure.
Encourage continued use of hearing protection to prevent further damage.

escalation.rationale_short: Evaluation confirmed noise-induced etiology; routine management and prevention indicated.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds for any progression of noise-induced hearing loss.

expected_outcome: Hearing loss confirmed as due to history of noise exposure.
Patient encouraged to continue using hearing protection when around loud sounds.
